goal.en:
"This course is a Ph.D. level course and focuses on the essence of continuous-time finance theories. Specifically, we examine the following issues in depth:
‧ Financial Calculus: We will examine the stochastic processes used in financial application, including random walk, Brownian motions, martingale, Girsanov Theory, Feyman-Kac theory and other probabilistic applications.
‧ The link between Financial Calculus and Finance: Based on the mathematics tool introduced in the class, we will examine the so-called Arbitrage Pricing theory, and fundamental theories of asset pricing; further, the martingale pricing theory for derivatives will also be introduced.
‧ Application in derivatives pricing: We will derive the Black and Scholes option pricing model after mathematical foundation and asset pricing knowledge are well constructed. Other exotic equity derivatives, including barrier and lookback options will also be examined.
‧ Other derivatives: exchange rate derivatives and term structure models will also be examined if time is available."
